item.title: 'That's the wicket' - Labuschagne takes brilliant grab to dismiss Jacks
item.description: Marnus Labuschagne takes another brilliant catch at slip as Will Jacks is dismissed for 47 to leave England on 337-8 on day five of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

item.title: The 10 moments that decided the Ashes
item.description: Australia have regained the Ashes after winning the first three Tests against England down under once again - here are the 10 moments that decided the destination of the urn.

item.title: England beaten to lose another Ashes in Australia
item.description: England's Bazball regime is in tatters as yet another Ashes series in Australia is lost at the earliest possible opportunity.

item.title: Injured spinner Lyon a doubt for rest of Ashes
item.description: Spinner Nathan Lyon is a doubt for the remainder of the Ashes after suffering a hamstring injury in Australia's series-sealing win in Adelaide.

item.title: Australian PM announces intelligence review as country mourns Bondi attack
item.description: Albanese says the country must be in a position to respond to "the rapidly changing security environment".

item.title: Lyon out of third Test and doubt for rest of Ashes
item.description: Injured Australia spinner Nathan Lyon will play no further part on the final day of the third Ashes Test and is a doubt for the remainder of the series.

item.title: 'It's frustrating' - Smith out for 60 after poor shot
item.description: Australia make the breakthrough as Jamie Smith is caught for 60 to leave England on 285-7, needing 150 runs to win the third Test on day five in Adelaide.

item.title: Lockerbie: 37 years on from atrocity, volunteers recall vital role
item.description: Amateur radio enthusiasts found themselves acting as a link between emergency crews.

item.title: Maxing out on tinsel: Why retro Christmas decorations are cool again
item.description: People are embracing excess and nostalgia again with huge demand for bold designs from the past, experts say.

item.title: 'This is the first Christmas without my wife - enjoying life with our boys is how I'll honour her'
item.description: Dad-of-two Andrew, 42, shares what he has learned about grief since his wife's sudden death.

item.title: Neither Russia nor France: One West African country walks a diplomatic tightrope
item.description: As some West African nations choose to cement old ties with France or a new ally in Russia, Togo wants both.

item.title: Isak injury in chaotic Liverpool win gives Slot more problems
item.description: Liverpool stretch their unbeaten run to six games but Alexander Isak's injury while scoring overshadows win at Tottenham.

item.title: India express train kills seven elephants crossing tracks
item.description: The collision happened early on Saturday in the north-eastern state of Assam, local officials say.

item.title: Comedian Bowen Yang announces Saturday Night Live exit
item.description: Yang, one of the most prominent cast members, also hosts a podcast and stars in the Wicked film series.

item.title: The Papers: George visits 'Di homeless shelter' and shops face 'last Christmas'
item.description: Prince George's visit to a homeless shelter and retailers' recession fears leads the Sunday papers.

item.title: The 'winners and losers' in Universal UK's plan to rival Disneyland Paris
item.description: Within its first 20 years, Universal is expecting more annual visitors than any park gets in Europe.

item.title: Weight-loss jabs: What happens when you stop?
item.description: You may have lost the weight you wanted to lose - but now you've stopped the jabs, how easy is it to keep it off?

item.title: Unexpected comebacks and operatic pop: The best albums and songs of 2025
item.description: From Pulp's unexpected comeback to Rosal√≠a's experimental pop, here's the best music of the year.

item.title: 'A good meal and a good poo': Kate Winslet describes how she dealt with media intrusion
item.description: The actor and director recalls being followed by paparazzi, having her phone tapped, and people looking through her bins after she shot to fame.

item.title: Why British Jews are experiencing their biggest change in 60 years
item.description: There have been shifts in how secure many British Jews feel - and how connected they feel to the rest of the community.
